Title:
Sarcopodium chlamydosporum, a new hyphomycete (Nectriaceae)
from the deep sea floor mut in Kagoshima Bay, Japan
Keywords: Anamorph, New species, Ocean, Phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Sarcopodium chlamydosporum, a new species classified in
the Nectriaceae (Ascomycota), was isolated from a deep-sea sediment
collected in Kagoshima Bay. It is characterized by chlamydospores, two
types conidiophores and aggregated in slimy masses conidia. Phylogenetic
analysis, this species closely related to Sarcopodium circinosetiferum
and S. macalpinei, but differs in productive chlamydospores. This
species is the first report with chlamydospores in the genus
Sarcopodium.
